1 %.description: The NPC‘s Steed bike is an improved model with a additional point of handling and an additional 100 AP.

À coup sûr (contact/distance).name: Unerring senbongiri (melee/ranged)
À coup sûr (contact/distance).description: When the NPC attacks in melee/ranged, they never miss. Their target‘s defence/reaction rating is automatically reduced to zero for their melee attacks.

À coup sûr (contact).name: Unerring senbongiri (melee)
À coup sûr (contact).description: When the NPC attacks in melee, they never miss. Their target‘s defence rating is automatically reduced to zero for their melee attacks.

À coup sûr (distance).name: Unerring senbongiri (ranged)
À coup sûr (distance).description: When the NPC attacks in ranged, they never miss. Their target‘s reaction rating is automatically reduced to zero for their melee attacks.

À revers.name: Backstab
À revers.description: Once per conflict phase, the NPC can take the characters by surprise, simply appearing behind them with each of its attacks. Their defense and reaction are then halved, and the NPC's damage is increased by 3D6 for the entire turn.

Abyssal.name: Abyssal
Abyssal.description: This NPC can only be damaged by weapons with an anti-Anathema or radiance effect.

Abysse.name: Abyss
Abysse.description: All damage inflicted by this NPC is dealt to the target’s hope points rather than its health or armour points.

Accablant.name: Damning
Accablant.description: If a PC kills this NPC, they must succeed at a hope check (Aggression combo Composure, difficulty set by the GM) or immediately lose 3D6 hope points.

Actions multiples (X).name: Multiple actions (X)
Actions multiples (X).description: The NPC has X extra combat action, in addition to their move action and standard combat action. It must use this additional action at its initiative phase.

Actions multiples (1).name: Multiple actions (1)
Actions multiples (1).description: The NPC has 1 extra combat action, in addition to their move action and standard combat action. It must use this additional action at its initiative phase.

Actions multiples (2).name: Multiple actions (2)
Actions multiples (2).description: The NPC has 2 extra combat action, in addition to their move action and standard combat action. It must use this additional action at its initiative phase.

Actions multiples (3).name: Multiple actions (3)
Actions multiples (3).description: The NPC has 3 extra combat action, in addition to their move action and standard combat action. It must use this additional action at its initiative phase.

Actions multiples (4).name: Multiple actions (4)
Actions multiples (4).description: The NPC has 4 extra combat action, in addition to their move action and standard combat action. It must use this additional action at its initiative phase.

Aisance.name: Ease
Aisance.description: In game terms, the NPC ignores the heavy effect of weapons. However, they must still hold them with two hands to be able to use them.

Amour parental.name: Parental Love
Amour parental.description: Although corrupted by the Anathema, the NPC remains attached to their child. If the PCs lead the assault with them, then the NPC is troubled. They lose the ability to perform multiple actions during their first phase (and only this phase).

Anathème.name: Anathema
Anathème.description: The NPC may choose to deal its damage to the target’s hope points rather than their health points. FF values still apply, but armour points are ignored. If the NPC is killed or destroyed, the PC or PCs whose energy was drained recover 1D6 hope per 6 whole hope points lost.

Anti-véhicule.name: Anti-vehicle
Anti-véhicule.description: Damage inflicted by this NPC always has the anti-vehicle effect.

Appel de la Chasse.name: Call of the Hunt
Appel de la Chasse.description: The NPC can decide to sacrifice all their combat actions to use their ranged attack. Note that to use it, they need energy points that they have previously drained. If the target's hope points fall to 0, they join the Wild Hunt (see Atlas).

Appui d'artillerie.name: Artillery Support
Appui d'artillerie.description: Once per combat, the NPC can call upon an artillery barrage that follows the rules of a level 1 rocket pod or a level 1 missile pod, with the additional effect of dispersion 6.

Armes multiples (1 à 3 avancées).name: Multiple weapons (1 à 3 advanced)
Armes multiples (1 à 3 avancées).description: The NPC can be equipped with X weapons up to the corresponding rarity in the arsenal.

Armes multiples (1 à 3 rares).name: Multiple weapons (1 à 3 rare)
Armes multiples (1 à 3 rares).description: The NPC can be equipped with X weapons up to the corresponding rarity in the arsenal.

Armes multiples (1 à 3 standards).name: Multiple weapons (1 à 3 standard)
Armes multiples (1 à 3 standards).description: The NPC can be equipped with X weapons up to the corresponding rarity in the arsenal.

Armes multiples (6 rares).name: Multiple weapons (6 rare)
Armes multiples (6 rares).description: The NPC can be equipped with 6 weapons up to the corresponding rarity in the arsenal.

Artisan de la Machine.name: Artisan of the Machine
Artisan de la Machine.description: The NPC is capable, similar to the NanoC mode of the Priest meta-armour, of creating and modifying the raw materials used by the Machine on Earth, namely everything that is metallic and informatic. Thus, they can create their weapons and modules (a maximum of 2 weapons and 2 advanced modules), shields, erect barricades, and assemble vehicles.

Assassin.name: Assassin
Assassin.description: When they attack their target by surprise or from behind, the NPC adds their Mask aspect score (exceptional Mask score included) to the damage they inflict.

Attaque spéciale.name: Special Attack
Attaque spéciale.description: The NPC can decide to sacrifice all their combat actions to use their special attack. Note that to use it, they need energy points that they have previously drained.

Aura de fureur.name: Aura of Fury
Aura de fureur.description: PCs and NPCs in the presence of the NPC must make a Cool-headed base roll with a difficulty of hard (5) or risk attacking, with the weapon of their choice, the person closest to them. This test is only performed once, at the beginning of a scene or conflict phase.

Aura de souffrance.name: Aura of sorrow
Aura de souffrance.description: A successful attack by a PC (or an NPC) on this NPC causes the attacker to take 2D6 damage with the ignore armour and ignore FF effects.

Autorité (majeur).name: Authority (major)
Autorité (majeur).description: If the NPC dies, all their followers flee or surrender immediately.

Autorité (mineur).name: Authority (minor)
Autorité (mineur).description: If the NPC dies, all other NPCs under their orders suffer a 3-point penalty to their aspects, their defence, and their reaction scores until the end of the conflict phase.

Autre visage.name: Makeover
Autre visage.description: This NPC can change its appearance whenever it wants, becoming a replica of any other living being. It can even do this in a conflict phase by expending a move action.

Bastion.name: Bastion
Bastion.description: The NPC‘s meta-armour is a very durable Warrior armour with all the prestige modules of the bear and the raven.

Berzerk.name: Berserk
Berzerk.description: The NPC‘s meta-armour combines the abilities of a Paladin and a Barbarian, gives its wearer 1D6 additional combat actions to be used on their initiative, and has all the prestige modules of the boar and the bear.

Bête humaine.name: Human beast
Bête humaine.description: This NPC has bestial traits, never tires, runs at a speed rating of 3, can breathe underwater, and has improved night vision.

Bouclier de bois noir.name: Black Wood Shield
Bouclier de bois noir.description: In the conflict phase, once per turn and just after suffering an attack but before calculating the damage, the NPC can add a bonus of 5 to their defense or reaction. If the attack fails after using this ability, then the attacker automatically loses 1D6 + 3 hope points without any reduction.

Câbles noirs.name: Dark cables
Câbles noirs.description: If a number of dark cables connected to the NPC are found and destroyed (the number required is up to the GM), the NPC’s overrun score resets to its initial value.

Cantatrice sombre.name: Dark Cantatrice
Cantatrice sombre.description: The NPC has 1 additional combat action to use one of their three ranged weapons.

Chant d'Anathème.name: Chant of Anathema
Chant d'Anathème.description: Whenever they are within long range of Eva, the PCs must remove 1 die from each of their tests. If they are within short range, the penalty increases to 2 dice, in addition to losing 1D6 hope points per turn.

Charge brutale.name: Brutal charge
Charge brutale.description: Once per encounter, the NPC can instantly move into contact range with a target up to medium distance. They must make an attack roll and, if successful, deal their weapon damage plus twice their Beast aspect score to their target.

Chevalier héroïque.name: Heroic Knight
Chevalier héroïque.description: The NPC has 6 standard, advanced, or rare modules to be defined and allocated by the GM. The equipment of these modules must respect the number of slots of the meta-armour.

Chevalier initié.name: Initiated Knight
Chevalier initié.description: The NPC has 4 standard or advanced modules to be defined and allocated by the GM. The equipment of these modules must respect the number of slots of the meta-armour.

Combat en duo.name: Twinned fighters
Combat en duo.description: The two NPCs wield a heavy weapon (a sonic blade) doubtless stolen from Avalon.

Conscience.name: Awareness
Conscience.description: The NPC knows everything that happens around them within a 2-kilometer radius. It is impossible to take them by surprise, no discussion is secret, and it is very difficult to lie to them.

Contradiction.name: Contradictions
Contradiction.description: When a PC fails a skill check against this NPC, they lose 1D6 hope points.

Contrôle.name: Control
Contrôle.description: This NPC can make a meta-armour act however it wants, up to long range (forcing it to move, shoot, fight, etc.). A character inside a meta-armour controlled this way can attempt to resist this ability with an Aggression or Tech based skill check against an arduous (6) difficulty. This ability requires a move or combat action to activate.

Coopération.name: Cooperation
Coopération.description: By coordinating their attacks, 2 NPCs (or more) with this ability gain a 2-point bonus to their defence and reaction values, and each has one additional combat action. This effect cannot stack multiple times on a given enemy.

Copie parfaite.name: Perfect copy
Copie parfaite.description: When a PC attempts to determine whether the NPC is a creature of the Anathema or not, they must succeed at an Acuity or Instinct based roll, arduous difficulty (6).

Croissance.name: Growth
Croissance.description: On round 4 of a conflict phase, the aberration gains the behemoth and Multiple actions (2) abilities, and loses Multiple actions (1).

Dards électriques.name: Stun needles
Dards électriques.description: The NPC may choose to inflict stun 2 (this effect is automatically successful on a single PC or NPC) instead of applying its overrun score.

Désespérant.name: Despair
Désespérant.description: If a PC kills this NPC, they must succeed at a hope check (Aggression combo Composure, difficulty set by the GM) or immediately lose 1D6 hope points.

Désespoir incarné.name: Embodied Despair
Désespoir incarné.description: The NPC is sensitive to the hope effect. Additionally, it is sensitive to attempts to bring it back to reason. When a PC performs a test to help this NPC return to the light, they must perform an opposed test against half of its Mask score (the GM must validate the basis of the test and the combo, then can adjust this difficulty based on the PC's arguments). If the PC succeeds, they automatically inflict 10 points of damage with the hope effect on the NPC's HP, without considering the FF and shield of the latter.

Destinée.name: Destiny
Destinée.description: The NPC can only die on the night of a full moon in the year 2039. If she reaches 0 HP for any reason, something unlikely will save her (GM’s choice).

Dévorant.name: Devouring
Dévorant.description: When this NPC misses an attack on a PC in contact range, the PC’s held weapon (or one of their held weapons if they are dual-wielding, GM’s choice) is destroyed. After this has happened at least once in a conflict phase, the targeted PC may choose to not avoid subsequent attacks and take damage rather than have another weapon be devoured. This ability cannot destroy prestige weapons or weapons with the alpha element enhancement. Destroyed weapons are replaced after the mission ends. This comes at a cost of a 5 GP penalty to earned GP at the end of the mission.

Dévoreur.name: Dévoreur
Dévoreur.description: Le PNJ ignore les scores d'égide et de bouclier, sauf conditions indiquées dans un scénario et en fonction des actions des PJ.

Digger.name: Digger
Digger.description: The NPC‘s meta-armour combines the abilities of a Priest and a Warmaster, allows them to pass through all solid matter including alpha element as if they had a phase module that can be activated at will, and has all the prestige modules of the raven and the wolf.

Dissimulé.name: Hidden
Dissimulé.description: This NPC provides cover for other Mask creatures, giving them a 2-point bonus to defence and reaction as long as they are at Medium range or closer.

Domination.name: Domination
Domination.description: Once per turn, at no action cost, the NPC may attempt to seize control of a character’s mind with a Machine skill check against a difficulty equal to the target PC’s Aggression score (including overdrives) (or another NPC’s Beast score). If they are successful, the target obeys the NPC’s orders on their following turn (and only their following turn), performing one combat action and one move action. The dominated character loses their turn and is unable to act.

Don de la Chair.name: Gifts of the Flesh
Don de la Chair.description: This NPC can heal a grievous wound (rolled on the random wounds table), but the healed character permanently loses 1D6 hope points (from both current and total hope).

Double face.name: Two-faced
Double face.description: When this NPC possesses a character, they can only be seen from behind on digital recordings and surveillance footage. From the front, they appear completely invisible.

Doubles.name: Copies
Doubles.description: Once per conflict phase, the NPC can create 2D6 copies of itself. These copies can act independently, but their aspect scores, substats, and damage are those of the NPC divided by 2.

Dragon.name: Dragon
Dragon.description: All Lancelot‘s attacks have the ray of hope effect.

Drain d'énergie.name: Energy drain
Drain d'énergie.description: The NPC may choose to deal its damage to the target’s energy points rather than to their health. FF values still apply, but armour points are ignored. If the NPC is killed or destroyed, the PC or PCs whose energy was drained recover 1D6 EP per 6 whole energy points lost. Energy drained this way can be used to power the NPC’s weapons; therefore the GM should keep track of how many it has. If the NPC uses an ability or weapon requiring the use of EPs, those it has obtained via its energy drain ability are used first.

Drogué à la penombra.name: Penumbra Addict
Drogué à la penombra.description: The NPC is a human who is more resistant than average, ignoring pain and therefore having more health points.

Drones Obake.name: Obake Drones
Drones Obake.description: Once per turn and up to three times in total per conflict phase, the Obake drones can open fire on their owners’ enemies. All PCs are automatically hit by the barrage, taking 5D6 + 10 damage (one roll each).

Duel.name: Duel
Duel.description: Once per conflict phase, the NPC can create an indestructible circle of energy around itself and a PC. No PC or NPC outside the circle can act within it, leaving the NPC and its opponent in a deadly face-off. Only a very difficult Endurance-based test (difficulty 9) allows anyone to end the duel; otherwise, it stops as soon as one of the combatants reaches 0 health points.

Écho.name: Echo
Écho.description: This NPC is a copy of one of the PCs. It copies all of their equipment and weapons (minus the radiance X, anti-Anathema, and ray of hope effects). Prestige weapons, prestige modules, and heroic abilities are not copied.

En réseau.name: Networked
En réseau.description: In order to destroy this NPC, they must be isolated in a containment unit. Otherwise, they can flee via network access points.

Enfants.name: Children
Enfants.description: The gang is mainly composed of children. Every time a PC attacks the gang without explaining how they act to avoid harming the gang members, they lose 1D6 hope points because it is difficult not to kill or seriously injure the children.

Entre les mondes.name: Between the Worlds
Entre les mondes.description: As long as it has not attacked, the NPC is considered to have double its defense and reaction. Once it has attacked, it becomes tangible until the end of the combat and possesses its normal defense and reaction scores.

Équipement (1 à 3 avancé).name: Equipment (1 to 3 advanced)
Équipement (1 à 3 avancé).description: The NPC has 3 weapons or modules of advanced quality or lower chosen from the arsenal. This ability may apply to an NPC without meta-armour. When this is the case, the NPC gains all the ability’s effects without having to spend any EP. They must still expend any activation time requirements. How the modules appear on the NPC is up to the GM to decide.

Équipement (1 à 3 rares).name: Equipment (1 to 3 rare)
Équipement (1 à 3 rares).description: The NPC has 3 weapons or modules of rare quality or lower chosen from the arsenal. This ability may apply to an NPC without meta-armour. When this is the case, the NPC gains all the ability’s effects without having to spend any EP. They must still expend any activation time requirements. How the modules appear on the NPC is up to the GM to decide.

Équipement (1 à 3 standard).name: Equipment (1 to 3 standard)
Équipement (1 à 3 standard).description: The NPC has 3 weapons or modules of standard quality or lower chosen from the arsenal. This ability may apply to an NPC without meta-armour. When this is the case, the NPC gains all the ability’s effects without having to spend any EP. They must still expend any activation time requirements. How the modules appear on the NPC is up to the GM to decide.

Équipement (2 avancé, 1 rares).name: Equipment (2 advanced, 1 rare)
Équipement (2 avancé, 1 rares).description: The NPC has 2 weapons or modules of advanced quality or lower chosen from the arsenal and 1 weapons or modules of rare quality or lower chosen from the arsenal. This ability may apply to an NPC without meta-armour. When this is the case, the NPC gains all the ability’s effects without having to spend any EP. They must still expend any activation time requirements. How the modules appear on the NPC is up to the GM to decide.

Équipement (10).name: Equipment (10)
Équipement (10).description: The NPC has 10 weapons or modules of rare quality or lower chosen from the arsenal. This ability may apply to an NPC without meta-armour. When this is the case, the NPC gains all the ability’s effects without having to spend any EP. They must still expend any activation time requirements. How the modules appear on the NPC is up to the GM to decide.

Équipement (10 rares).name: Equipment (10 rare)
Équipement (10 rares).description: The NPC has 10 weapons or modules of rare quality or lower chosen from the arsenal. This ability may apply to an NPC without meta-armour. When this is the case, the NPC gains all the ability’s effects without having to spend any EP. They must still expend any activation time requirements. How the modules appear on the NPC is up to the GM to decide.

Équipement (10 avancé).name: Equipment (10 advanced)
Équipement (10 avancé).description: The NPC has 10 weapons or modules of advanced quality or lower chosen from the arsenal. This ability may apply to an NPC without meta-armour. When this is the case, the NPC gains all the ability’s effects without having to spend any EP. They must still expend any activation time requirements. How the modules appear on the NPC is up to the GM to decide.

Équipement (10 standard).name: Equipment (10 standard)
Équipement (10 standard).description: The NPC has 10 weapons or modules of standard quality or lower chosen from the arsenal. This ability may apply to an NPC without meta-armour. When this is the case, the NPC gains all the ability’s effects without having to spend any EP. They must still expend any activation time requirements. How the modules appear on the NPC is up to the GM to decide.

Espion.name: Spy
Espion.description: This NPC is in constant communication with the Lady. If one (or more) of these NPCs is present in a conflict phase, as long as it remains within long range, it gives all other creatures under the Lady’s command 3 automatic successes on their skill checks. This effect only applies once, no matter how many spying NPCs are present in a scene.

État d'alerte.name: State of Alert
État d'alerte.description: The NPC is searching for its target. If the PCs fail a Stealth test (5), the gang spots its target and attacks.

Étoile mourante.name: Dying Star
Étoile mourante.description: If the heroes manage to reduce the NPC to 0 HP using the hope effect, then it does not have a phase 2. It starts crying for days, then seeks redemption. However, if the PCs do not manage to reduce it to 0 HP in this way, then the NPC's phase 2 is particularly difficult. The Mask has completely possessed it, and it becomes almost an incarnation of the Mask.

Évolution.name: Evolution
Évolution.description: As long as this NPC is present in a conflict phase, its NPC allies at long range or closer gain one of the following effects: continuous damage 3, stun 2, wounding, destructive, or barrage 3.

Excalibur.name: Excalibur
Excalibur.description: Arthur‘s meta-armour combines the abilities of all 9 of the first meta-armour models, and has all the prestige modules of the lion, the bear, the bull, and the hawk.

Excalibur corrompue.name: Corrupted Excalibur
Excalibur corrompue.description: The meta-armour possesses the capabilities of the first 9 existing meta-armour models.

Exosquelette de combat (nvX).name: Combat exoskeleton (lvl X)
Exosquelette de combat (nvX).description: The NPC has exceptional aspect scores and lvl X leap and sprint modules. If the NPC’s AP reaches 0, they lose these bonuses.

Exosquelette de combat (nv1).name: Combat exoskeleton (lvl 1)
Exosquelette de combat (nv1).description: The NPC has exceptional aspect scores and lvl 1 leap and sprint modules. If the NPC’s AP reaches 0, they lose these bonuses.

Exosquelette de combat (nv 1).name: Combat exoskeleton (lvl 1)
Exosquelette de combat (nv 1).description: The NPC has exceptional aspect scores and lvl 1 leap and sprint modules. If the NPC’s AP reaches 0, they lose these bonuses.

Faille vivante.name: Living portal
Faille vivante.description: During a conflict phase and at the start of each turn, the favoured of the Mask can summon forth a Child of the Mask in contact range. In addition to this, it can create a Mask spawn every four turns.

Fantôme.name: Phantom
Fantôme.description: The NPC‘s meta-armour combines the abilities of a Rogue and a Ranger and has all the prestige modules of the hawk and the serpent.

Fille de l'Ophidien.name: Daughter of the Ophidian
Fille de l'Ophidien.description: When the NPC is attacked by an enemy, the GM must roll 1D6. On an odd result, a snake appears in a corner (if possible) to defend it. This ability cannot be used when at least one snake is present in the scene or the conflict phase.

Fille/Fils à maman.name: Mama's Boy/Girl
Fille/Fils à maman.description: If the NPC is somehow held captive, their Lord will do everything to free them.

Flamme.name: Flame
Flamme.description: When Lancelot‘s falcon soars above his enemies and unleashes its piercing cry, they suffer the radiance 6 effect for the rest of the fight. This requires no action on the NPC‘s behalf.

Fleuve de ténèbres.name: Fleuve de ténèbres
Fleuve de ténèbres.description: Le PNJ fait naître dans son sillage un fleuve de ténèbres duquel sort à chaque tour soit : une nuée du Masque (si aucune n'est présente dans la phase de conflit), 2D6 enfants du Masque, 1D6 rejetons du masque ou 1D3 favoris du Masque. Elles n'attaquent pas les PJ en mecha-armures mais peuvent s'attaquer à des chevaliers ou des civils.

Fu-Mari.name: Fu-Mari
Fu-Mari.description: The NPC‘s Warrior meta-armour has one of Avalon‘s strongest force fields, with a score of 30, and has all the prestige modules of the boar and the serpent.

Fujin.name: Fujin
Fujin.description: The NPC‘s Barbarian meta-armour grants them the ability to use its Goliath mode to its maximum potential without increasing in size and without the associated downsides (such as lower defence and reaction scores), and has all the prestige modules of the boar and the lion.

Fureur de Raijin.name: Raijin‘s Wrath
Fureur de Raijin.description: The NPC may spend between 1 and 25 EP to increase his fracture cestis‘ damage. Blue flames appear around his meta-armour and the air around him bends and waves. For each EP spent, NPC adds 2 points of damage to his next attack with the cesti, up to a maximum of 50 added points on a single attack.

Gargoyle.name: Gargoyle
Gargoyle.description: The NPC may always choose to redirect enemy attacks toward themselves, taking all the damage they would have inflicted.

Génie.name: Genius
Génie.description: The NPC can restore 6D6 + 10 AP of a meta-armour‘s missing armour per turn. He can also improve a weapon, giving it an additional 1D6 damage, violence, or an extra effect until the end of the conflict phase. At the cost of one turn, he can also build a trap or any simple electronic device from spare parts.

Giant.name: Giant
Giant.description: With their nanoC mode, the NPC can create any weapon or module from the arsenal, regardless of cost or rarity. Weapons created this way only last 1D6 turns, but are fully functional.

Gideon.name: Gideon
Gideon.description: Although embodying Mordred and being herself an incarnation of the Mask, Morgane remains attached to her son Gideon. If the PCs lead the assault with him, then Morgane is troubled. She loses the multiple actions (2) ability during her first phase (and only this phase).

Griffe des ténèbres.name: Claw of Darkness
Griffe des ténèbres.description: Once per turn, the NPC can ignore armour points and inflict its damage directly on health.

Grosse artillerie.name: Heavy artillery
Grosse artillerie.description: On the battlefield, the NPC uses a bulkier than usual Paladin meta-armour with the ability to fire 4 times per round (with whatever weapons the GM deems appropriate)

Gueule du vide.name: Maw of the Void
Gueule du vide.description: When the NPC inflicts damage or overflow on a character, it is also inflicted on armour points, energy points, hope points, and health points. All these values are reduced simultaneously, without considering the Aegis score.

Haine de l'Anathème.name: Hatred of the Anathema
Haine de l'Anathème.description: The NPC’s damage gains +3D6 against creatures of the Anathema.

Hybridation.name: Hybridation
Hybridation.description: The NPC serves two Overlords. Any ’Overlord’ abilities are based on two aspects (GM’s choice) rather than one.

Hypersensibilité lumineuse.name: Light sensitive
Hypersensibilité lumineuse.description: Using equipment with a radiance effect cancels one or more of the NPC’s abilities (at the GM’s discretion) for 1D6 turns. Damage dealt to this NPC by weapons with a radiance effect is doubled.

Ignore CdF.name: Ignore FF
Ignore CdF.description: The NPC ignores force fields, as per the ignore FF weapon effect.

Il est partout.name: Everywhere at once
Il est partout.description: The NPC’s attacks target all PCs engaged in the conflict (apart from those who are hidden or invisible), regardless of distance or behaviour.

Immatériel.name: Immaterial
Immatériel.description: The NPC is immaterial and is immune to damage. The only way to damage it is to attack it with weapons with a radiance or an anti-Anathema effect while in the presence of pure alpha element (pure alpha element saps nearby characters’ hope at a rate of 1D6 hope points per turn).

Immortel.name: Immortal
Immortel.description: The NPC may use a move action to restore 10 to 100 (GM’s choice) of its lost health points. This ability may only be used once per turn in conflict phases.

Immunité technologique.name: Technological immunity
Immunité technologique.description: The NPC is immune to all stun X and interference X effects.

Implacable.name: Unstoppable
Implacable.description: If the NPC does not use their move action during their turn, they may perform an additional attack.

Incarnation de l'Ophidien.name: Incarnation of the Ophidian
Incarnation de l'Ophidien.description: The NPC, by concentrating and performing a ritual under specific conditions, can create a rift between Earth and the Abyss. The longer it spends creating the rift, the larger it becomes and the more people it can allow through. The specific rules are defined by the current scenario or directly by the GM.

Indestructible.name: Invincible
Indestructible.description: Weapons with the anti-vehicle effect are required to damage this NPC. Violence from weapons with an anti-vehicle effect also reduces its cohesion.

Infestation.name: Infestation
Infestation.description: All non-dark beings that do not benefit from adequate protection, such as meta-armour, automatically suffer 1D6 points of damage per turn at long range.

Infiltré.name: Infiltrator
Infiltré.description: The NPC could be anyone, and is very difficult to differentiate from average humans, even when there are several of them. An Acuity or Instinct based skill check, difficulty delicate (4), is required to spot them.

Insaisissable.name: Slippery
Insaisissable.description: The NPC cannot be hit by attacks that need to surpass its defence score (cannot be combined with untouchable).

Insensibilité physique.name: Physical immunity
Insensibilité physique.description: The NPC cannot be harmed by conventional weapons. Only hope, or fighting it in the dream world, can defeat it.

Intangible.name: Intangible
Intangible.description: While it is in its smoke form, the NPC suffers no weapon damage or violence unless the weapon has the anti-Anathema effect. While intangible, it cannot do anything against characters in meta-armour. This ability may only be activated or deactivated once per turn in conflict phases.

Intouchable.name: Untouchable
Intouchable.description: The NPC cannot be hit by attacks that need to surpass its reaction score (cannot be combined with slippery).

Intouchable puis insaisissable.name: Untouchable then Slippery
Intouchable puis insaisissable.description: On even turns, the NPC becomes vaporous and gains the untouchable ability. On odd turns, the NPC becomes as fast as lightning and gains the slippery ability. These two abilities are mutually exclusive and cannot be present at the same time in the creature's profile.

Invisibilité.name: Cloaking
Invisibilité.description: This NPC has the same abilities as a Rogue meta-armour, with the same restrictions.

Invulnérabilité.name: Invulnerability
Invulnérabilité.description: To inflict any damage on the target, a character must first reduce its resilience to 0, even if the attack used has the anti-vehicle effect. Indeed, as long as the character or vehicle has resilience points, invulnerability allows it to ignore all damage, even that with the anti-vehicle effect.

Isolement.name: Isolation
Isolement.description: Once per encounter, the NPC may isolate one or more characters in the scene by trapping them inside large cubes of ice and silence, each one with 100 AP. These cubes last until they are destroyed. An NPC with this ability can attack through these cubes’ walls. Isolated characters can attack the walls and activate modules, but otherwise cannot move. They cannot fire weapons through the walls, even with weapons with an artillery effect.

Jardinier de chair.name: Flesh gardener
Jardinier de chair.description: At the start of a conflict phase the aberration creates fleshy flora with 400 cohesion points in the surrounding area.

Jumelles.name: Twins
Jumelles.description: These two NPCs act as a single entity, reducing their HP to 0 means that one of the pair has been killed or knocked out and that the other ceases combat in order to save them.

Kamikaze.name: Kamikaze
Kamikaze.description: When the NPC reaches its target it can explode, dealing 8D6 + 15 damage with a scatter 6 effect up to short range around it.

Korrigan.name: Korrigan
Korrigan.description: Palamedes‘ AI has access to the combined intelligence of the arks, Avalon, and all secret service agencies.

Loyauté sans faille.name: Unshakable loyalty
Loyauté sans faille.description: This NPC never flees and never surrenders.

Lumière.name: Inner light
Lumière.description: An invisible brightness emanates from the NPC, deterring creatures of the Anathema from coming closer than Medium range. If for some reason they were to be closer, they suffer the full effects of a Radiance 6 weapon effect until they move away.

Machine évolutive.name: Evolving Machine
Machine évolutive.description: The NPC is currently primitive and does not even know how to speak. Upon contact with humans, it will quickly learn everything it can from them, starting with speech. When PCs interact with the NPC and depending on their conversations, the GM is free to evolve the NPC's aspects as well as its exceptional aspects.

Maison-Dieu.name: The Tower
Maison-Dieu.description: The NPC may use its The Tower power for one combat action.

Maître de la destruction.name: Master of Destruction
Maître de la destruction.description: The NPC's attacks that should reduce the resilience of its targets cause an additional 1D6 points of resilience loss. Buildings, beings, and vehicles smaller than 8 meters are automatically destroyed by its attacks, without damage or violence rolls. PCs without mecha-armour are not destroyed but are brought to the brink of death.

Maître du destin (majeur).name: Master of Fate (major)
Maître du destin (majeur).description: As many times per turn as there are characters (PC and NPCs included) in a scene, the NPC can cause a PC or NPC (including herself) to automatically succeed or fail one of their actions.

Maître du destin (mineur).name: Master of Fate (minor)
Maître du destin (mineur).description: Once per turn, the NPC can cause a PC or NPC (including himself) to automatically succeed or fail at one of their actions.

Marée serpentine.name: Serpentine Tide
Marée serpentine.description: The NPC is always accompanied by a band of small terrestrial snakes of all kinds. This swarming tide is to be treated as a band of noctes with 1000 cohesion.

Mecha-armure Tengû.name: Mecha-armour Tengû
Mecha-armure Tengû.description: The mecha-armour benefits from the following modules: flight level 3 or jump level 3, shoulder turret equipped with a Sol Invictus cannon, 2 missile pods, 2 rocket pods, countermeasures level 3.

Mecha-shogun.name: Mecha-shogun
Mecha-shogun.description: The mecha-armour benefits from the following modules: flight level 3, shoulder turret equipped with a Sol Invictus cannon, 2 missile pods, 2 rocket pods, countermeasures level 3, strike amplification level 3, Thunder security.

Membre du Knight.name: Avalon’s Finest
Membre du Knight.description: This NPC has one of Avalon’s meta-armours, a melee weapon and a ranged weapon, and 2 modules chosen from the arsenal (standard, advanced, or rare quality, depending on the Knight’s difficulty rating).

Mémoire.name: Memory
Mémoire.description: The NPC is capable of knowing the complete past of all characters it encounters and the mistakes they have made. Each failed Speech, Aura, or Composure-based test against it results in the loss of 1D6 hope points.

Meneur d'hommes.name: Leader
Meneur d'hommes.description: This NPC gives other allied NPCs under their orders a 2-point bonus to defence and reaction, as well as an additional 2 overrun points and 50 cohesion to allied bands.

Méta-armure (12 points d'aspect exceptio.name: Meta-armour (12 exceptional aspect points / 1 to 4 rare modules)
Méta-armure (12 points d'aspect exceptio.description: The NPC has exceptional aspect scores and X modules of rare quality or lower chosen from the arsenal. If the NPC’s AP reaches 0, they lose these bonuses until their armour is repaired.

Méta-armure (4 points d'aspect exception.name: Meta-armour (4 exceptional aspect points / 1 to 4 standard modules)
Méta-armure (4 points d'aspect exception.description: The NPC has exceptional aspect scores and X modules of standard quality or lower chosen from the arsenal. If the NPC’s AP reaches 0, they lose these bonuses until their armour is repaired.

Méta-armure (8 points d'aspect exception.name: Meta-armour (8 exceptional aspect points / 1 to 4 advanced modules)
Méta-armure (8 points d'aspect exception.description: The NPC has exceptional aspect scores and X modules of advanced quality or lower chosen from the arsenal. If the NPC’s AP reaches 0, they lose these bonuses until their armour is repaired.

Méta-armure (Bard).name: Meta-armour (Bard)
Méta-armure (Bard).description: The NPC possesses the capabilities of a Bard meta-armour with evolution at 150 and 200 PG total.

Méta-armure (Paladin).name: Meta-armour (Paladin)
Méta-armure (Paladin).description: The NPC possesses the capabilities of a Paladin meta-armour with 5 rare modules and evolutions at 300 PG.

Méta-armure (Priest).name: Meta-armour (Priest)
Méta-armure (Priest).description: The NPC possesses the capabilities of a Priest meta-armour with evolution at 150 and 200 PG total.

Méta-armure (Rogue).name: Meta-armour (Rogue)
Méta-armure (Rogue).description: The NPC possesses the capabilities of a Rogue meta-armour with evolution at 150 and 200 PG total.

Méta-armure (Rogue 5 rare).name: Meta-armour (Rogue)
Méta-armure (Rogue 5 rare).description: The NPC possesses the capabilities of a Rogue meta-armour and 5 modules up to rare from the arsenal. If its AP drops to 0, these benefits are canceled, until the armour is repaired.

Méta-armure (Wizard).name: Meta-armour (Wizard)
Méta-armure (Wizard).description: The NPC possesses the capabilities of a Wizard meta-armour with 5 rare modules and evolutions at 300 PG.

Méthodique.name: Methodical
Méthodique.description: If the NPC’s target has used its move action to move this turn, it does not deal any overrun damage to that target.

Mitraillage.name: Mitraillage
Mitraillage.description: Lorsque le PNJ attaque à distance, il reçoit un bonus de 1 réussite automatique à ses jets.

Module (nom du module avancé au nvX).name: Module (advanced module name at lvl X)
Module (nom du module avancé au nvX).description: The NPC benefits from the equivalent of the module indicated at level X.

Module (nom du module rare au nvX).name: Module (rare module name at lvl X)
Module (nom du module rare au nvX).description: The NPC benefits from the equivalent of the module indicated at level X.

Module (nom du module standard au nvX).name: Module (standard module name at lvl X)
Module (nom du module standard au nvX).description: The NPC benefits from the equivalent of the module indicated at level X.

Module (saut/vol/course nv3).name: Module (Leap/Flight/Sprint lvl 3)
Module (saut/vol/course nv3).description:
Allows the user to jump to a height equal to long range and to a distance of far range (up to half a mile). Target destination at far range is reached 2 turns later (the activation turn is spent in the air, the following turn too, with the character landing on turn 3). While in midair, the character can still perform ranged attacks, at a penalty of -2 successes on their attack roll. They gain +2 to their reaction score while leaping. Upon landing 2 turns after a far range leap, the character may use their combat action and move action as usual. Changing direction while midair is possible, but to do so requires a Movement based skill check (difficulty to be determined by the GM). If a lvl 3 leap module is used to jump into contact range and attack an enemy with a melee weapon, the user deals an additional 12 damage./

Allows the character to move up to far range in one move action (as much as a vehicle speed rating of 4). This increased run speed can be prolonged without stopping by paying the energy cost again each move action, and can be done as often as the user wants and can pay. If the user performs a melee combat action while running at increased speed against an adversary slower than them, they deal 12 additional damage to their target. The force of the impact deals half the attack’s damage (rounded down) back to the attacker.

Allows the character to fly up to long range in one move action (as much as a vehicle speed rating of 3). Duration increases to 10 turns / 100 seconds. Flight duration may be extended (without interruption) by spending the activation cost as for long as the character can afford it.

Module (saut nv2).name: Module (Leap lvl 2)
Module (saut nv2).description: Allows the user to jump to a height equal to medium range and to a distance of long range. Target destination at long range is reached on the following turn. While in midair, the character can still perform ranged attacks, at a penalty of -2 successes on their attack roll. They gain +2 to their reaction score while leaping. Upon landing on the turn after a long leap, the character may use their combat action and move action as usual. If a lvl 2 leap module is used to jump into contact range and attack an enemy with a melee weapon, the user deals an additional 9 damage.

Module (phase nv2).name: Module (Phase module lvl 2)
Module (phase nv2).description:
The character can phase or pass through matter. Over the course of one action, they can travel (horizontally or vertically) through 20 inches of any solid matter except alpha element. To travel through thicker surfaces, they must pay additional energy at a cost of one activation per 20 inches of matter. If the character is stuck in solid matter, they are disintegrated and die outright.

Level 2

A character with a phase module may now activate it to avoid a single attack. The attack deals no damage, as if it had missed.

Modules rares.name: Rare Modules
Modules rares.description: On its meta-armour, the NPC has all the rare modules from the list of modules in the Knight core rulebook's arsenal. Basic or advanced modules that can evolve to the rare level are also included.

Monture.name: Mount
Monture.description: The NPC's steed allows it to benefit from additional points in the Beast aspect as well as in defense and reaction (already included in the profile). To knock it down, one must succeed in a Movement-based test against its Flesh aspect divided by 2 and have at least one level 3 Force overdrive.

Né dans la lumière.name: Born in the light
Né dans la lumière.description: This NPC is immune to all radiance and anti-Anathema effects.

Né dans les ténèbres.name: Born in the Darkness
Né dans les ténèbres.description: The NPC is immune to the effects of domination, anathema, fear (X), contradiction, and aura of suffering.

Noyau central.name: Central Core
Noyau central.description: The central core of the supercomputer containing the NPC does not move. If it is destroyed, everything the NPC controlled is released from its grip. In return, the core receives the invulnerability rule and 10 points of resilience.

Obscurité impénétrable.name: Impenetrable Darkness
Obscurité impénétrable.description: The NPC is immune to the light effect generated by weapons, tools, or modules. It remains sensitive to the light effect generated by art.

Ogre.name: Ogre
Ogre.description: The NPC is immune to the fear ability and all Anathema damage they receive is divided by 2.

Ombre d'Excalibur.name: Shadow of Excalibur
Ombre d'Excalibur.description: A dark copy of Excalibur always stands by the NPC's side and fights with it. It has exactly the same profile as the NPC, but with fewer abilities and without its FF. The shadow can be completely destroyed, but if the NPC is defeated, it disappears.

Oubli.name: Oblivion
Oubli.description: Rather than suffering overflow, damage, and effects, a PC can always choose to sacrifice a memory. If the PC chooses this option, the GM inflicts one of these effects (at their choice): loss of 3D6 hope points, loss of a contact, loss of a characteristic point (from the lowest ones), loss of a heroic ability, loss of 3D6 total glory points.

Parangon.name: Paragon
Parangon.description: The NPC‘s meta-armour combines the abilities of a Rogue and a Warmaster and has all the prestige modules of the hawk and the dragon.

Parangon de lumière.name: Paragon of Light
Parangon de lumière.description: More talented than most other humans, the prodigy seems to succeed in everything they undertake. When making a test, the NPC can reroll, once per test, any dice that do not show successes.

Parasite.name: Parasite
Parasite.description: When it fights within an allied or enemy band, this NPC cannot die. If it reaches 0 HP, its parasite finds a new host and rises again with half its maximum health points on the next turn.

Parole du Seigneur.name: Word of the Lord
Parole du Seigneur.description: PCs who attempt to attack the NPC in melee automatically suffer the effect of Major Exceptional Lady. If the NPC does not have the Exceptional Lady aspect, it is considered to be 5.

Peur (X).name: Fear (X)
Peur (X).description: When a conflict phase with this NPC (or several NPCs with the fear ability) starts, all PCs must make a Composure or Aggression based skill check against one of the NPC’s aspects (chosen by the GM) divided by two. If they succeed, they suffer a -1 D penalty to all their rolls. If they fail, they suffer a -X D penalty to all their rolls and their reaction and defence values suffer a 2-point penalty. In the event of a critical failure, the PC is frozen in terror for 2D6 turns and cannot do anything. This effect can only apply to a PC once per turn.

Peur (1).name: Fear (1)
Peur (1).description: When a conflict phase with this NPC (or several NPCs with the fear ability) starts, all PCs must make a Composure or Aggression based skill check against one of the NPC’s aspects (chosen by the GM) divided by two. If they succeed, they suffer a -1 D penalty to all their rolls. If they fail, they suffer a -1 D penalty to all their rolls and their reaction and defence values suffer a 2-point penalty. In the event of a critical failure, the PC is frozen in terror for 2D6 turns and cannot do anything. This effect can only apply to a PC once per turn.

Peur (2).name: Fear (2)
Peur (2).description: When a conflict phase with this NPC (or several NPCs with the fear ability) starts, all PCs must make a Composure or Aggression based skill check against one of the NPC’s aspects (chosen by the GM) divided by two. If they succeed, they suffer a -1 D penalty to all their rolls. If they fail, they suffer a -2 D penalty to all their rolls and their reaction and defence values suffer a 2-point penalty. In the event of a critical failure, the PC is frozen in terror for 2D6 turns and cannot do anything. This effect can only apply to a PC once per turn.

Peur (3).name: Fear (3)
Peur (3).description: When a conflict phase with this NPC (or several NPCs with the fear ability) starts, all PCs must make a Composure or Aggression based skill check against one of the NPC’s aspects (chosen by the GM) divided by two. If they succeed, they suffer a -1 D penalty to all their rolls. If they fail, they suffer a -3 D penalty to all their rolls and their reaction and defence values suffer a 2-point penalty. In the event of a critical failure, the PC is frozen in terror for 2D6 turns and cannot do anything. This effect can only apply to a PC once per turn.

Peur (4).name: Fear (4)
Peur (4).description: When a conflict phase with this NPC (or several NPCs with the fear ability) starts, all PCs must make a Composure or Aggression based skill check against one of the NPC’s aspects (chosen by the GM) divided by two. If they succeed, they suffer a -1 D penalty to all their rolls. If they fail, they suffer a -4 D penalty to all their rolls and their reaction and defence values suffer a 2-point penalty. In the event of a critical failure, the PC is frozen in terror for 2D6 turns and cannot do anything. This effect can only apply to a PC once per turn.

Phase 2.name: Phase 2
Phase 2.description: Once the NPC has been reduced to death’s door for the first time this conflict phase, it recovers all its HP, AP, and EP (if it has any) and gets back into the fight. This ability can only trigger once per conflict phase. Additionally, the NPC’s stats and abilities may increase or be otherwise improved during phase 2. These changes should be included in the ability description. Its tactics may also change. Make a note of which aspects and related scores increase, and which abilities are gained. An NPC entering phase 2 always becomes more powerful than it was before.

Phéromones.name: Pheromones
Phéromones.description: The NPC can summon all creatures of darkness in a 5-mile radius to it and give them orders, even if they were not its creations or servants to begin with.

Pilote émérite.name: Ace pilot
Pilote émérite.description: When piloting her steed motorbike, Bors has one additional combat or move action per turn.

Planificatrice.name: Planner
Planificatrice.description: In any conflict phase involving this NPC, her allies choose their initiative score and can change it at the beginning of each round.

Possession.name: Possession
Possession.description: This NPC may take control of Amaterasu, Iwata Kaneda’s meta-armour, and use it to fight (using the stat block for Iwata Kaneda’s substats, weapons, and aspects apart from Machine and Lady).

Pour une nuit.name: Just one night
Pour une nuit.description: If this NPC strikes a bargain with a character (PC or NPC), it may possess their body for one night and do what it wants during that time. The possessed character will have no recollection of its actions at the end of the night.

Prescience.name: Prescience
Prescience.description: The NPC always attacks in a way that hits the enemy's weak point. It can always inflict maximum damage with its weapons.

Presque humain.name: Almost Human
Presque humain.description: The NPC still remembers part of its past and retains human attitudes. It is therefore easier for it to communicate with the PCs and gain their sympathy.

Prévoyant.name: Foresight
Prévoyant.description: The NPC has prepared several exits, traps, and automated weapons to ensure its safety and defend against potential enemies. When the NPC is encountered in a location, it may have hidden a secret exit, two explosive traps to be treated as smart grenades that can be triggered at long range, as well as an automated turret equipped with a heavy machine gun or a railgun.

Prime.name: Bounty
Prime.description: This NPC may put a bounty on one or several characters’ heads, making them the target of bounty hunters.

Protégé.name: Protected
Protégé.description: The NPC controls elite members of a faction who stay close to it and protect it.

Protéiforme majeur.name: Shapechanger major
Protéiforme majeur.description: The NPC may change shape and give itself weapons with the following effects, at the GM’s discretion: ignore FF, ignore armour, stun 2.

Protéiforme mineur.name: Shapechanger minor
Protéiforme mineur.description: The NPC may change shape and give itself weapons with the following effects, at the GM’s discretion: wounding, destructive, or stun 1.

Psychopathe.name: Psychopath
Psychopathe.description: If the NPC designates one or more PCs as its prey, it hunts them to the death.

Puissance de l'Éther.name: Power of the Ether
Puissance de l'Éther.description: Against creatures of the Anathema, meta-armours, and anything that comes from the darkness, the NPC always inflicts an additional 3D6 points of damage. Each of its attacks also possesses the anti-Anathema and light 6 effects. Finally, the Aegis score does not apply against the NPC's attacks.

Rapide.name: Rapide
Rapide.description: The NPC gains an additional movement action. This action is to be performed at its initiative. The NPC gains +3 in reaction.

Rayon.name: Beam
Rayon.description: The NPC may use all of its combat actions to perform its beam ranged attack. It must have drained 30 EP during the encounter to use this ability.

Regain de santé.name: Emergency repairs
Regain de santé.description: As long as this NPC (or several of the same type) is present, its Overlord’s bands regain 6D6 cohesion, brutes regain 3D6 health, badasses regain 4D6 health, and bosses regain 6D6 health per conflict phase turn. The NPC itself also regains 6D6 cohesion each turn.

Régénération.name: Regrowth
Régénération.description: Si le PNJ combat au milieu d'une bande alliée, il peut lui infliger une attaque gratuite pour se régénérer d'autant de points de santé que les dégâts infligés. Les dégâts infligés sont convertis en violence et impactent directement la cohésion de la bande.

Renaissance.name: Rebirth
Renaissance.description: If this NPC is fighting alongside an allied band, it can attack the band once per turn as a bonus action to regain as many health points as it deals damage. Its damage is converted to violence and is inflicted on the band’s cohesion.

Résistance lumineuse.name: Light resistant
Résistance lumineuse.description: Despite them being creatures of the Anathema, she-wolves ignore all radiance X and anti-Anathema effects.

Résistant.name: Durable
Résistant.description: Regardless of actual size, the NPC is treated as a behemoth.

Résistant au présent.name: Resistant to the Present
Résistant au présent.description: The NPC always suffers half the damage or violence inflicted, except under conditions specified in a scenario and depending on the actions of the PCs.

Ressources illimitées.name: Unlimited resources
Ressources illimitées.description: This NPC has access to all the resources they need, be it money, materials, or people.

Rubilacxe.name: Rubilacxe
Rubilacxe.description: The twin meta-armour of Excalibur possesses the capabilities of the first 9 existing meta-armour models, as well as 9 modules to be chosen from any module in the arsenal.

Sabotage.name: Sabotage
Sabotage.description: Once per conflict phase, any enemy of the NPC coming into short range suffers a detonation dealing 7D6 + 10 damage and an automatic stun 2 effect.

Sensibilité IEM.name: EMP sensitive
Sensibilité IEM.description: EMP grenades used against this NPC automatically have an interference 4 effect.

Sentence.name: Sentence passed
Sentence.description: If this NPC passes judgment on a character, the other Triarchs will relentlessly pursue them until they are killed or until they manage to change the Voice’s mind.

Serial killer.name: Serial killer
Serial killer.description: If an attack by this NPC deals damage to their target’s HP, the NPC adds their Mask score to the damage total.

Serpent titanesque.name: Titanic Serpent
Serpent titanesque.description: The NPC possesses all the capabilities of a serpent in addition to its other abilities. Its aspect scores and exceptional aspect scores can exceed 20 and 10, respectively.

Sherlock.name: Sherlock
Sherlock.description: The NPC‘s meta-armour combines the abilities of a Bard and a Warmaster and has all the prestige modules of the stag and the horse.

Solar.name: Solar
Solar.description: The NPC‘s meta-armour combines the abilities of a Priest and a Wizard and has all the prestige modules of the hawk and the bear.

Sombre marcheur.name: Dusk Walker
Sombre marcheur.description: Creatures of the Anathema never attack or notice this character unless the character provokes them or displays hostile intentions towards them.

Sous les ordres.name: Just following orders
Sous les ordres.description: PCs performing actions that go against the orders this NPC receives from their Immortal may force them to turn hostile or become more difficult to handle.

Sphère de force.name: Force sphere
Sphère de force.description: The sphere the NPC lives in has 100 AP and a FF of 30.

Spores.name: Spores
Spores.description: This NPC can emit spores that find their way into an NPC’s respiratory system and latch onto their body. At any point in the future, the spore-emitting NPC can activate the spores, killing its victim from within, gradually or instantaneously. This effect only applies to other NPCs, since Knights are immune to the spores thanks to their meta-armour.

Surhomme (18 points d'aspect exceptionne.name: Superhuman (18 exceptional aspect points)
Surhomme (18 points d'aspect exceptionne.description: The GM may distribute X exceptional aspect points as they wish. The NPC gains all the usual bonuses granted by exceptional aspects.

Surhomme (3 points d'aspect exceptionnel.name: Superhuman (3 exceptional aspect points)
Surhomme (3 points d'aspect exceptionnel.description: The GM may distribute X exceptional aspect points as they wish. The NPC gains all the usual bonuses granted by exceptional aspects.

Surhomme (9 points d'aspect exceptionnel.name: Superhuman (9 exceptional aspect points)
Surhomme (9 points d'aspect exceptionnel.description: The GM may distribute X exceptional aspect points as they wish. The NPC gains all the usual bonuses granted by exceptional aspects.

Surhomme (3 à 18 points d'aspect excepti.name: Superhuman (3 to 18 exceptional aspect points)
Surhomme (3 à 18 points d'aspect excepti.description: The GM may distribute 3 to 18 exceptional aspect points as they wish. The NPC gains all the usual bonuses granted by exceptional aspects.

Surhomme (Penumbra).name: Superhuman (Penumbra)
Surhomme (Penumbra).description: When it ingests penumbra, the NPC benefits from 3 points in its exceptional aspects and their effects.

Tailles diverses.name: Varying size
Tailles diverses.description: Some NPCs of this type can be considered Behemoths. The GM should plan accordingly when setting up a mission.

Talon d'Achille.name: Achilles' Heel
Talon d'Achille.description: When it attacks a character, the NPC systematically hits, and it inflicts damage to the lowest value among armour points, energy points, or hope points.

Tarot.name: Tarot
Tarot.description: By reading his personal pack of cards, the NPC can tell the future, but these readings are always enigmatic.

Téléportation (élément).name: Teleportation (element)
Téléportation (élément).description: The NPC can appear and disappear at will, travelling from element to element.

Téléportation (ombre).name: Teleportation (shadow)
Téléportation (ombre).description: The NPC can appear and disappear at will, travelling from shadow to shadow.

Téléportation (portée courte).name: Teleportation (short range)
Téléportation (portée courte).description: The NPC can appear and disappear at will, travelling to short range.

Téléportation (mur).name: Teleportation (Wall)
Téléportation (mur).description: The NPC can appear and disappear at will, travelling from wall to wall.

Terreur.name: Terror
Terreur.description: At the beginning of each turn, characters must make an Aggression combo Composure skill check against an arduous (6) difficulty in order to not be frozen with fear. If they fail this check, they cannot act during that turn.

Tireur d'élite.name: Elite Sniper
Tireur d'élite.description: All firearms used by the character no longer have a range limit.

Trahison vivante.name: Living Betrayal
Trahison vivante.description: By using a movement or combat action, the NPC can attempt to bend the will of a target through a test under the Mask aspect opposed to the target PC's Ferocity (with overdrives) (or Beast divided by 2 for a PNJ). If successful, the target must, at the beginning of their next turn, attack one of their allies with one of their combat actions. They must only perform one attack and play normally for the rest of the turn. This effect lasts for one unique turn and can be used up to two times during the same combat turn.

Tremblement de terre.name: Earthquake
Tremblement de terre.description: The NPC’s attacks all have the stun 1 effect.

Tueurs d'éclats (X).name: Shard Killers (X)
Tueurs d'éclats (X).description: When facing the Lord in question, the NPC gains 10 automatic successes on its attack and an additional 10D6 damage, regardless of the techniques or weapons used.

Union.name: Meld
Union.description: Two NPCs with the same name can meld together to form a more powerful entity, with the same name and type as its constituent parts. The newly created entity has an additional 2 points in all its aspect scores, an additional 3D6 to 5D6 damage (at the GM’s discretion), and twice the usual health points. The only drawback is its increased size, halving its defence and reaction. An entity created by melding with another can meld with yet more NPCs of the same type, becoming even stronger.

Versatile.name: Versatile
Versatile.description: The NPC has one of the following modules at level 1: a leap module, flightm module, grip module, or a sneak module. These represent the NPC’s bestial traits, and require no EP to activate.

Versatilité ultime.name: Ultimate Versatility
Versatilité ultime.description: The NPC adapts to each attack in the conflict phase. As soon as it is hit in melee, it instantly gains the elusive ability for the remainder of the turn. It loses this ability if it is hit by a ranged attack (even if this attack is received during the same turn). Furthermore, as soon as the NPC is hit by a ranged attack, it instantly gains the untouchable ability. It loses this ability if it is hit by a melee attack (even if this attack is received during the same turn).

Vitesse de la lumière.name: Speed of Light
Vitesse de la lumière.description: The NPC receives a bonus to its reaction and initiative. When it moves, it can do so by flying or teleporting to medium range.

Vol.name: Flight
Vol.description: The NPC may fly up to long range in one turn (as much as a vehicle speed rating of 3).

Affidé du Seigneur.name: Overlord’s acolyte
Affidé du Seigneur.description: The NPC adds 5 times their Overlord’s aspect value to their HP (or AP) total. Exceptional aspect scores do not add additional HP or AP. Reminder: réservé aux créatures affiliées à un des cinq Seigneurs suivants : Chair, Bête, Machine, Dame ou Masque.

Élu du Seigneur.name: Overlord’s chosen
Élu du Seigneur.description: The NPC’s aspect score can be increased above 20 in their Overlord’s aspect, and its corresponding exceptional aspect can be increased above 10. These scores cannot exceed 40 (for aspects) or 20 (for exceptional aspects). Reminder: can only be given to creatures affiliated with one of the five following Overlords: Flesh, Beast, Machine, Lady, or Mask.

Protégé du Seigneur.name: Overlord’s protection
Protégé du Seigneur.description: Attacks against the NPC with a combo characteristic that depends on the creature’s Overlord’s aspect do half damage. Reminder: can only be given to creatures affiliated with one of the five following Overlords: Flesh, Beast, Machine, Lady, or Mask.

Tueur du Seigneur.name: Overlord’s executioner
Tueur du Seigneur.description: When the NPC’s target has an aspect score of 7 or more (or 14 or more for an NPC) in their Overlord’s aspect, the NPC increases their damage by a fixed amount equal to their Overlord’s aspect score (disregarding any exceptional aspect scores the NPC may have). Reminder: can only be given to creatures affiliated with one of the five following Overlords: Flesh, Beast, Machine, Lady, or Mask.

Serviteur du Seigneur.name: Overlord’s thrall

Reminder: can only be given to creatures affiliated with one of the five following Overlords: Flesh, Beast, Machine, Lady, or Mask.
